title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 March 2012 - XWiki
content:

07:59 <ash3003> has joined #xwiki  
08:02 <ash3003> hello  
08:03 <@sdumitriu> Hi ash3003  
08:19 <ash3003> i want to work on the poll/survey application for gsoc  
08:20 <ash3003> i have no experience with xwiki, but shall go through it today  
08:21 <ash3003> is there something that I need to consider for using xwiki?  
08:22 <@sdumitriu> For using? Nothing in particular, but you can read as much documentation as you want from platform.xwiki.org and then dev.xwiki.org (for development)  
08:23 <ash3003> ok thanks for that  
08:25 <vishnu> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <vishnu> has quit  
08:30 <florinciu> has quit  
08:31 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <ash3003> has quit  
08:50 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Can I ask you not to keep saying that HSQLDB is not a production-ready database? That's very bad advertisement on our part  
08:50 <@sdumitriu> It is ready for production as long as the wiki stays small  
08:50 <vmassol> hi sdumitriu  
08:51 <vmassol> we need to discuss this because for me it's never a good choice  
08:51 <vmassol> it's not a production DB for me  
08:52 <vmassol> but maybe I'm coming from the older days of hsqldb and now it has reached a level of production  
08:52 <@sdumitriu> Why? It is more standards-compliant than almost all the other databases, and it is also faster  
08:52 <vmassol> IMO the opposite is more dangerous  
08:52 <vmassol> saying that it's production ready  
08:52 <@sdumitriu> We should run some performance tests  
08:52 <vmassol> and then getting users saying that xwiki is not working  
08:52 <vmassol> because it's slow  
08:52 <@sdumitriu> I'm not saying that we should say it's production ready  
08:53 <vmassol> the problem is that you cannot say "provided the wiki stays small"  
08:53 <vmassol> that has not specific meaning  
08:53 <@sdumitriu> Just say in a less offensive way that other databases should be used  
08:53 <vmassol> yep I'm fine with that if we find the right worjing  
08:53 <vmassol> wording  
08:53 <vmassol> when I wrote this  
08:53 <vmassol> I almost changed it  
08:53 <vmassol> thinking that if the hsqldb guys read it they might be offended  
08:54 <vmassol> but my worry was for them not for our users  
08:54 <vmassol> so I'm fine to find a less aggressive wording  
08:55 <vmassol> production for me means: tunability to handle large number of users, powerful admin tools, backups solutions, replication solutiosn, etc  
08:55 <vmassol> what we could say instead  
08:55 <vmassol> is that our standalone package is not produciton-ready  
08:55 <vmassol> wdyt?  
08:56 <vmassol> (it's not tuned to handle large volumes for example, nor is it tuned with correct # of threads, cache values, etc)  
08:56 <vmassol> bbiab  
08:57 <@cjd> "production ready" can mean a lot of things, to some people it just means "it's gonna eat your data" which couldn't be further from the truth.  
08:59 <@cjd> My understanding is it borrows threads from the http thread pool since calls are made directly, this is theoretically one of the best possible solutions from a performance standpoint.  
09:01 <@cjd> "While HSQLDB is a mature, stable, and high performance database, it keeps the dataset in memory which is inappropriate for large deployments" or something the like?  
09:05 <ash3003> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: +1 for saying that the standalone is not tuned  
09:13 <@sdumitriu> cjd: Not even that is entirely true  
09:13 <@sdumitriu> That is the default configuration  
09:13 <@sdumitriu> But HSQLDB does support disk caching and only a limited set of data in memory  
09:14 <@cjd> Why aren't we using that?  
09:14 <@sdumitriu> One day when I'll have some free time I'd like to properly configure Hibernate and HSQLDB so that it would work very well  
09:14 <@sdumitriu> We're not using that because nobody had the time to read the manual  
09:14 <@cjd> hah  
09:15 <@cjd> No multiwiki support is a pain, other than that it would be awesome to get more users running on the default/most tested version  
09:15 <@sdumitriu> Again, not reading the manual  
09:16 <@sdumitriu> HSQLDB does have support for multiple databases  
09:16 <@cjd> Well thanks for letting me know that it exists.  
09:16 <@cjd> re on disk storage  
09:20 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <mflorea> has quit  
09:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <faryshta> has quit  
09:56 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <qwebirc21732> Hi everybody, I'd like to modify (or even create a new page template), to show in any page, the list of groups having access to the page, according to the rights defined in its space webpreferences.  
10:08 <qwebirc21732> (we were talking about it yesterday)  
10:09 <vmassol> qwebirc21732: btw you might be interested by the thread on the list about the "new" rights UI  
10:09 <vmassol> it was talking about things like this  
10:09 <vmassol> I think it's http://markmail.org/message/yexffrzd6yfdah6u  
10:16 <qwebirc21732> thanks vmassol, I had a look at it, but it's mostly to define rights..  
10:19 <qwebirc21732> I'm looking for a reminder / remark that basically shows in any page which group is able to read that page (actually the space)  
10:20 <vmassol> AFAIK this was also our idea  
10:20 <vmassol> to display this in the "information" tab at the bottom of pages  
10:22 <qwebirc21732> that would be an option too  
10:23 <qwebirc21732> I cannot find this information in the link you gave me, is it mentioned there?  
10:25 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <vishnu> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <vmassol> qwebirc21732: I don't know, I just remember we discussed it at some point  
10:31 <qwebirc21732> my ideas was actually to add a "getspacegroups.vm" template, showing this info as for example the "hierarchy.vm" template is showing the parent of a given document  
10:32 <ssavi> has quit  
10:32 <qwebirc21732> it should really be easy  
10:36 <vishnu> vmassol, hi  
10:36 <vishnu> I have xwiki-enterprise in my local system and I did a build successfully  
10:37 <vishnu> I am wondering now, if I have to change any '.vm' files where should I do that?  
10:38 <vishnu> I mean so that I can create a patch out of the changes I made?  
10:56 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r15b6c89 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/15b6c89e0d77e75f774d2272abd59ad81e5e14ff / (2 files): [misc] Improved logging - http://git.io/BgPwwA

12:34 <+tmortagne> vmassol: btw I just looked at sonar and the duplication are between common and previous platform location of the same code so looks like a sonar bug actually  
12:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok, the reason is maybe because they run sonar on various parts not at the same time….  
12:39 <vmassol> we need to ask them to fix this  
12:39 <ash3003> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <vmassol> I'm pinging simon  
12:43 <+tmortagne> maybe they run it right during the move  
12:44 <vmassol> yes maybe we were just unlucky  
12:44 <vmassol> anyway i've pinged him  
12:44 <vmassol> on sjype  
12:44 <vmassol> skype  
12:44 <vmassol> waiting for his response  
12:44 <+tmortagne> ok  
12:44 <vmassol> I'd really like us to use sonar more and more in the future  
12:44 <vmassol> I think it provides useful information  
12:45 <vmassol> we need to learn how to use it best and what metric we want to use/follow  
12:45 <+tmortagne> yes there is lot of useful information in it  
12:56 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r1b9b9ae https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/1b9b9ae12a4dff74a70c697db7c68a43a4a83047 / xwiki-commons-core/pom.xml : XCOMMONs-141: Don't build legacy modules by default - http://git.io/CrRDLQ

13:05 <vmassol> fixing

13:47 <vmassol> when do you plan to start the release?  
13:48 <+tmortagne> vmassol: when class reference bahavior is decided and committed  
14:43 <vmassol> Enygma`: hi, do you think you could look at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7668 quickly before the M2 release (since it's a regression)  
14:47 <vishnu> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <+Enygma`> vmassol: looking...  
14:49 <vishnu> hi vmassol  
14:50 <vmassol> hi  
14:51 <vishnu> I have xwiki-enterprise in my local system and did a build successfully  
14:51 <vishnu> and I am able to deploy the war in tomcat  
14:53 <vishnu> Now I am trying to work on issue XWIKI-4383, I am not able to go to Administration page! any clue?  
14:53 <vmassol> you need to read the install doc  
14:54 <vmassol> (on xwiki.org)  
14:54 <vmassol> and follow the steps there  
14:54 <vmassol> here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation  
14:54 <vmassol> or rather http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationWAR since you're installing the WAR  
14:55 <qwebirc21732> XWiki API permits to check rights on a document for a given user through "$xwiki.hasAccessLevel($level,$user,$docname)", is there anything similar for "group" instead of "user"?  
14:56 <vishnu> oh.. okay! thanks!  
15:00 <+tmortagne> qwebirc21732: same API for group  
15:00 <+tmortagne> it actually takes group or user  
15:00 <qwebirc21732> great!  
15:01 <qwebirc21732> it's not working for admingroup, is that possible?  
15:01 <qwebirc21732> nevermind, O'll figure it out, but thanks!  
15:02 <+tmortagne> XWiki.XWikiAdminGroup ?  
15:03 <+tmortagne> there is no such group as "admingroup" by default at least  
15:03 <+tmortagne> qwebirc21732:  
15:04 <qwebirc21732> yep XWiki.XWikiAdminGroup  
15:07 <arpitgyl> has quit  
15:07 <+tmortagne> qwebirc21732: actually I was wrong, $xwiki.hasAccessLevel does not support user, that's the API which is used by this API...  
15:07 <+tmortagne> s/user/group/  
15:08 <+tmortagne> (just checked the code)  
15:08 <+tmortagne> so I don't really know how to test group right from public API  
15:11 <qwebirc21732> ok, thanks :(  
15:11 <+tmortagne> you don't have programming right ?  
15:12 <qwebirc21732> :S I'm the admin.. but i never understood what that means..  
15:13 <+tmortagne> if you are admin in standalone wiki or on the main wiki then you have programming right but you don't if you only have admin right on a subwiki  
15:13 <qwebirc21732> (ok then I have them  
15:14 <+tmortagne> in that case you can use "private" API  
15:14 <qwebirc21732> can I insert such code in a template.vm file?  
15:15 <+tmortagne> nop  
15:15 <+tmortagne> well  
15:15 <+tmortagne> template has the right of the current page so it actually depends of the page so not very stable  
15:16 <+tmortagne> so generally it's mostly in pages  
15:16 <faryshta> has quit  
15:16 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
15:18 <qwebirc21732> I see.. I'd like to show in any page (as an included template) the list of groups having access to the page (or its space)  
15:18 <qwebirc21732> but i think I'll give up..  
15:18 <qwebirc21732> it seems to difficult  
15:23 <vishnu> Hi, I am having problem in importing the .xar file into my xwiki. All it says is "error while preparing importing"  
15:23 <vishnu> any clue??  
15:26 <+tmortagne> qwebirc21732: a "trick" you would use maybe is to test the right of some special user in each group which only exist in this group  
15:27 <+tmortagne> like <the group name>User  
15:27 <+tmortagne> XWiki.XWikiAdminUser  
15:27 <+tmortagne> you crate one in each group and do $xwiki.hasAccessLevel($level,"${group}User",$docname)  
15:28 <+tmortagne> just need to make sure to never give direct right to those special users  
15:29 <+tmortagne> but that only work for you of course, if you plan to distribute you code it's not really a solution  
15:30 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r5fd7430 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/5fd7430089f348437653f37a1e2e3c1bebc7bab7 / xwiki-enterprise-web/pom.xml : XE-1142: Don't package legacy modules when not running in CI/Release ...  
15:34 <qwebirc21732> +tmortagne, that's a great workaround, I could go for it, since I do have a fake user for each group i create for testing puropses  
15:35 <qwebirc21732> ;)  
15:36 <qwebirc21732> Thanks a lot, have a nice day!  
15:36 <+tmortagne> qwebirc21732: you'r welcome :)  
15:37 <qwebirc21732> has quit
